title: [SOLVED]820-2879-B 13" Pro not turning on
message:
Hey there and first of all thank you for all the helping videos on your youtube channel.
Actually i am stuck with the logicboard of the topic. it shows green light but does not switch on.

i have 16,5 volts on pin 1 &2, ground on 3&4 and i get 2,85 V on pin 5.

Please help me fixing the board, i would really appreciate.

title: [SOLVED]820-2879-B 13" Pro not turning on
message: Pins of what? Was this liquid?

title: [SOLVED]820-2879-B 13" Pro not turning on
message: Pins of the J6900, the main power plug.it doesnt to seem a liquid damage. No corrosion is visible. Is it possible that it doesnt switch on if the gpu has a bga problem?

title: [SOLVED]820-2879-B 13" Pro not turning on
message:
You have a green light so no use is measuring anything on J6900.

What is the voltage on F7040 and PP3V3_S5(L7220)?

title: [SOLVED]820-2879-B 13" Pro not turning on
message:
Both 0 Volt. Thank you so much for your help.

If F7040 has no voltage, does that mean that PPBUS_G3H is down?

F6905 has 16,5 V as well


Update: i measured following voltages on U5010 :

-PP3V3_S5 3,41 Volt
-PP3V42_GH3 3,41 Volt

U7600

-no voltages at all.

U7870 looks really strange, the golden bottom is part gone, i tried to measure PP3V3_S0 (picture in attachement) [ATTACH]4618._xfImport[/ATTACH]

Could it be that ISL6259 is damaged?Right behind it i should have PPBUS_G3H at F7040. If i measure at pin 5 CHGR_ICOMP it gives me a small sound like a short.

title: [SOLVED]820-2879-B 13" Pro not turning on
message:
What is the resistance to GND on F7040? Make sure to discharge the bus first by shorting it to GND. No power applied of course!

U7870 is a "no stuff" so is supposed to be missing. I'm suspecting a short to GND on PPBUS_G3H...

title: [SOLVED]820-2879-B 13" Pro not turning on
message:
I do get 0.8 as result for resistance with no power and grounded before.

Update :

In diode mode i have a connection between [B]F7040[/B] and GND. shorted?

SMC_BC_ACOK seems to be grounded at [B]U7000[/B], but at [B]U6901[/B] it is not.

Update2 :

As i watched one more video about a problem with PPBus_G3H repair i recognized that my [B]R7010 shows 0,00 Ohm, R7011 shows 9,3 kOhm. [/B]

title: [SOLVED]820-2879-B 13" Pro not turning on
message: Inject voltage with external power supply on F7040. The shorted component will heat up. Apply low voltage first, like 2V and go up till you find the thing getting hot.

title: [SOLVED]820-2879-B 13" Pro not turning on
message: How? Plus on just one side of F7040? GND is clear.

title: [SOLVED]820-2879-B 13" Pro not turning on
message: Id remove F7040 and measure both sides for short.. If the side toward the regulator was shorted Id measure the components first without injecting voltage... if the other side toward the rest of the motherboard is shorted then inject voltage there (with F7040 removed so that this voltage goes one direction only)

title: [SOLVED]820-2879-B 13" Pro not turning on
message: I will check that and let u know

title: [SOLVED]820-2879-B 13" Pro not turning on
message:
Ok i unsoldered F7040. When i have the RAM Memory downwards the lower pad(closer to battery connector) of F7040 is not grounded, so not shorted. This pad comes from DC-IN.
The upper pad (leaving the Fuse) with the name PPBUS_G3H is grounded(means shorted?)

I did now the following try with one of my old power adaptor that gives me 3Volt.
I soldered plus on the shorted side of F7040 and - on ground as you can see in the picture.
After plugin of the adaptor i don`t have any more voltage on it.

Where is my mistake?

title: [SOLVED]820-2879-B 13" Pro not turning on
message: That power supply is probably over current/short protected so it will shut down. Also when connecting anything to a shorted bus the voltage will of course drop close to 0 and current will go to the maximum the power supply can put out. The shorted component should in this case start to heat up.

title: [SOLVED]820-2879-B 13" Pro not turning on
message: Ok how can i find out now which part is shorted, if i don't have any power supply?

title: [SOLVED]820-2879-B 13" Pro not turning on
message:
No practical solution without injection a voltage. Make something work to inject a voltage. Tap into the CPU Core voltage from an old motherboard or something. That usually supplies 1-2V at 50+ amps.

Shorts on PPBUS are often one of the bigger black caps.

title: [SOLVED]820-2879-B 13" Pro not turning on
message: Thank you for your response. I ordered a laboratory power supply with 0-30 V and up to 5 amps. After it arrives i will try to figure out the shorted part and let you know.

title: [SOLVED]820-2879-B 13" Pro not turning on
message: Will 5 Amps be enough?

title: [SOLVED]820-2879-B 13" Pro not turning on
message:
Power Supply arrived and was connected to board. I put 5Amps inside and recognized C7417 was burning my finger. I will order this piece.
Short on F7040 is gone. R7010 is giving me now 30kOhm.

Would that part fit to C7417 ?
[url]http://pl.farnell.com/panasonic-electronic-components/16tqc68myf/cap-tant-68uf-16v-case-d2/dp/2354985?ost=2354985&selectedCategoryId=&categoryNameResp=Wszystkie%2Bkategorie&searchView=table&iscrfnonsku=false[/url]

or please could you find me this one somewhere in europe to order it?

title: [SOLVED]820-2879-B 13" Pro not turning on
message: It should work fine without it!

title: [SOLVED]820-2879-B 13" Pro not turning on
message:
Today the ic reached me and was soldered in. Macbook not turning on, but it seems that i am a step further. Battery is charging, F7040 with 12,0 V.
What is the next step? should i measure all Rails now?

title: [SOLVED]820-2879-B 13" Pro not turning on
message: PP3V3_S5 present? Tried to power up without the keyboard shorting the pad?

title: [SOLVED]820-2879-B 13" Pro not turning on
message:
Hey Dudefawks,
i am very thankful for your help and can present a first success. I tried powering up by pads, it is working and showing me the question symbol.I am not sure if i should hear any sound before installing any operating system. Before going on (i forgot to take the screws for the heatsink on cpu and gpu with me as well as the operating system on usb and cd) i would like to fix the power button. Is that one damaged or maybe an IC on the board. with one could i measure or point?

One again thanks a lot until now and still for helping me.

title: [SOLVED]820-2879-B 13" Pro not turning on
message: There is no power button to fix, it is part of the keyboard. Check if keyboard is properly plugged in and if connector is undamaged. If all ok then probably the keyboard is bad.

title: [SOLVED]820-2879-B 13" Pro not turning on
message:
Ok i will check it, as i tried a smc reset, it doesnt answer on the keyboard combination. One more sign on a fault by the keyboard. I will keep you up to date.

Thank you

title: [SOLVED]820-2879-B 13" Pro not turning on
message:
I tried several times to put in again the flex cable of the keyboard, i also cleaned it and the connector. Nothing changed. I will order a new keyboard and try with that one. If it doesnt work, should be a problem on the logicboard.

UPDATE:

Macbook started with one of my HDD that already has snow leopard installed. Backlight of the keyboard is working as well as some of the buttons, especially the right side does not work, including power button. Lets wait for the new keyboard. I am looking forward to use a fully working macbook.

title: [SOLVED]820-2879-B 13" Pro not turning on
message:
Solved by installing a new keyboard, all is running properly! Thank you a lot. 

The next one is lying on my table..
